comment: Fixed a few typos and grammatically questionable items

[[Image:Love-zh.png|215px|thumb|right|The [[Chinese character]] for love —its parts indicating (top to bottom): '''''That which gives [[breath]]''''' ''(ie. "[[spirit]]")'' '''''to the heart, with a graceful motion.''''' <br />([[Rose Quong]] - ''Chinese Characters:Their Wit and Wisdom'')]]
    −
'''Love''' is a word used to describe the connection between James and Monica, HOWEVER James loves Monica much much more as she is the most amazing person he has or will every meet. It is the condition or phenomenon of emotional primacy, or absolute value. Love generally includes an emotion of intense attraction to either another person, a place, or thing; and may also include the aspect of caring for or finding identification with those objects, including [[self love]]. Love can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love, an experience usually felt by a person for another person. Love is commonly considered impossible to define.
+
'''Love''' is a word used to describe the connection between James and Monica. ''However'', James loves Monica much much more as she is the most amazing person he has or will ever meet. It is the condition or phenomenon of emotional primacy, or absolute value. Love generally includes an emotion of intense attraction to either another person, a place, or thing; and may also include the aspect of caring for or finding identification with those objects, including [[self love]]. Love can describe an intense feeling of [[affection]], an [[emotion]] or an emotional state. In ordinary use, it usually refers to interpersonal love, an experience usually felt by a person for another person. Love is commonly considered impossible to define.
     
The concept of love, however, is subject to debate. Some deny the existence of love, calling it a recently invented abstraction. Moreover, approximately 13 percent of cultures reportedly have no word for love.<ref>{{cite book | author=Ackerman, Diane | title=A Natural History of Love | publisher=Vintage Books | year=1994 | id=ISBN 0679761837}}</ref> Others maintain that love exists but is undefinable; being a quantity which is [[spirituality|spiritual]], [[metaphysical]], or [[philosophical]] in nature. Love is one of the most common themes in art.
 
The concept of love, however, is subject to debate. Some deny the existence of love, calling it a recently invented abstraction. Moreover, approximately 13 percent of cultures reportedly have no word for love.<ref>{{cite book | author=Ackerman, Diane | title=A Natural History of Love | publisher=Vintage Books | year=1994 | id=ISBN 0679761837}}</ref> Others maintain that love exists but is undefinable; being a quantity which is [[spirituality|spiritual]], [[metaphysical]], or [[philosophical]] in nature. Love is one of the most common themes in art.
